Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Quasi-size-sieving effect with preferential adsorption due to Lewis basic sites

Other Information.Additional Info: C3H6 uptake: 56.0 cm3 g−1; C3H6 storage density: 0.602 g mL−1

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Electrostatic repulsion and steric hindrance within the pore channel

Other Information.Additional Info: C3H8 uptake significantly reduced to 23.5 cm3 g−1

Sieving Mechanism: Quasi-size-sieving effect combined with electrostatic repulsion for C3H8

Experimental Validation.Method: Breakthrough experiment, single-crystal X-ray diffraction (SCXRD), GCMC simulation
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: IAST selectivity: 71; Breakthrough experiment separation factor: 15.3; High-purity C3H6 productivity: 19.4 L kg−1

Other Information.Additional Info: TYUT-23 demonstrated excellent reusability over six continuous cycles and maintained performance under humid conditions (75% relative humidity)
